IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Organized as a community action program to operate programs and services that reduce the causes and effects of poverty on the residents of aroostook county. the programs are designed to enable the people of aroostook county to acheive greater economic independence and dignity and to provide leadership to the community in responding to human needs.
IRS990.MissionDescription: ACAP PROVIDES SERVICES AND RESOURCES THAT HELP INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES ACHIEVE GREATER ECONOMIC INDEPENDENCE. AS A LEADER, OR IN PARTNERSHIP WITH OTHERS, ACAP PROVIDES GUIDANCE TO THE COMMUNITY IN RESPONDING TO EMERGING HUMAN NEEDS.
IRS990.Description: Energy & Housing - includes section 8 rental assistance, affordable housing programs, home ownership education, weatherization, the low income home energy assistance program and the temporary housing assistance program.

Activity2.Description: Child & family services - offers head start, child care, child and adult care food program, and the resource development center.

Activity3.Description: Health services - operates health clinics, provides counseling and education services, operates the supplemental food program for women, infants and children (WIC), operates an emergency food assistance program and provides oral health education services.

ActivityOther.Description: Employment & training - offers assistance to people who are seeking employment as well as businesses seeking employees. services offered include information centers, workforce investment act services, welfare to work, maine job start, and employer assistance services.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: ACAP is required to assess whether it is more likely than not that a tax position will be sustained upon examination on the technical merits of the position assuming the taxing authority has full knowledge of all information. If the tax position does not meet the more likely than not recognition threshold, the benefit of that position is not recognized in the financial statements. ACAP has determined there are no amounts to record as assets or liabilities related to uncertain tax positions. Federal returns for the fiscal years ended 2007, 2008, and 2009 remain subject to examination by the Internal Revenue Service.
PART XII, LINE 4B: LOSS ON SALE OF ASSET: $-9,208 PART XIII, LINE 2D: ADDITIONAL DEPRECIATION: $-63,262 PART XIII, LINE 2D: ASSETS PURCHASED WITH GRANT FUNDS: $646,704

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: ENERGY AND HOUSING SERVICES - Weatherization services, LIHEAP, Section 8 rental assistance, housing programs
HEALTH SERVICES - Health clinic operations, counseling and education services, food programs
EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING - Employment training programs and classes
CHILD AND FAMILY SERVICES - Head Start Program, child care, Child and adult food program, and Resource Development Center
COMMUNITY SERVICES - Substance abuse program, tobacco prevention, various community programs

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The board of directors is provided with a copy of the 990 for their review and approval.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Annually all board members and employees review, disclose and sign a conflict of interest policy.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization uses a variety of processes in order to determine compensation. The organization uses an external salary survey, establishes labor market salary ranges, conducts performance reviews establishing goals and objectives, measures achievement on goals and objectives, and considers agency financial ability to establish fair compensation.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available in the annual report and on the organization's website.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: PROCESS FOR OVERSIGHT OF AUDIT AND SELECTION OF INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: NO CHNAGES TO THIS PROCESS DURING THE TAX YEAR.
